canonical_explanation.text: Pressure is defined as force per unit area. When the same force is applied over a smaller area, pressure increases. The SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa). Pressure in liquids increases with depth and acts equally in all directions at a point. Atmospheric pressure is the pressure exerted by air on all surfaces. Evidence of atmospheric pressure includes phenomena like drinking through a straw and suction cups sticking to surfaces. Pressure concepts explain many everyday observations like why sharp knives cut better and why buildings need broad foundations.
rules: SI unit of pressure: Pascal (Pa) = N/m^2.
Same force on smaller area = greater pressure.
Pressure in liquids increases with depth.
Liquids exert pressure in all directions.
Atmospheric pressure: pressure exerted by air.
Drinking straws work due to atmospheric pressure.

questions.question_text: Pressure is defined as:
questions.explanation_correct: Pressure is defined as the force divided by the area over which the force is applied. This is because the same amount of force exerted over a smaller area will result in higher pressure, while the same force over a larger area will result in lower pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pressure is not defined as force multiplied by area, area divided by force, or force plus area. Pressure is a measure of the force being applied per unit of area, so the correct definition is force divided by area.

questions.question_text: What is the SI unit of pressure?
questions.explanation_correct: The SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa) because pressure is defined as force per unit area, and the SI unit of force is Newton (N). So the SI unit of pressure, which combines force and area, is Newton per square meter (N/m^2), which is also known as Pascal (Pa).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the correct SI unit of pressure. Newton is the SI unit of force, not pressure. Joule is the SI unit of energy, not pressure. Watt is the SI unit of power, not pressure. The correct SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa), which represents the force per unit area.

questions.question_text: Thrust is defined as:
questions.explanation_correct: Thrust is defined as the force acting perpendicular (at right angles) to a surface. This is because thrust is the force that pushes or pulls an object in a specific direction, and this force is always perpendicular to the surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Thrust is not the same as force acting parallel to a surface (option A), nor is it the same as pressure on a surface (option C). Thrust is also not the area of a surface (option D). Thrust is specifically the force acting perpendicular to a surface, which pushes or pulls an object in a certain direction.

questions.question_text: If the area decreases and force remains the same, pressure:
questions.explanation_correct: If the area decreases and the force remains the same, the pressure will increase. This is because pressure is defined as the force applied divided by the area. So, if the force stays the same but the area gets smaller, the pressure will become higher.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect option is that pressure remains the same. This is not correct because pressure is directly related to the area - if the area decreases and the force stays the same, the pressure will actually increase. The pressure becomes higher when the same force is applied over a smaller area.

questions.question_text: Pressure in a liquid:
questions.explanation_correct: Pressure in a liquid increases with depth because the weight of the liquid above exerts more force on the lower layers. This means the pressure is higher at greater depths in the liquid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pressure in a liquid does not decrease with depth. The weight of the liquid above creates a higher pressure on the lower layers. Pressure also does not remain constant or become zero - it increases the deeper you go in a liquid.

questions.question_text: Pressure in a liquid at a given depth acts:
questions.explanation_correct: Pressure in a liquid acts equally in all directions at a point because the liquid particles can move freely in all directions, transmitting the pressure equally in all directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pressure in a liquid does not act only upward, downward, or sideways, because the liquid particles can move freely and transmit the pressure equally in all directions. The correct answer is that pressure acts equally in all directions at a point in the liquid.

questions.question_text: Atmospheric pressure is the pressure exerted by:
questions.explanation_correct: Atmospheric pressure is the pressure exerted by air all around us. Air has weight and this weight presses down on the Earth's surface, creating atmospheric pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Atmospheric pressure is not caused by water, solid objects, or light. Water pressure increases with depth, but atmospheric pressure is caused by the weight of the air in the Earth's atmosphere pressing down on the surface. Solid objects and light do not exert significant pressure on the Earth's surface.

questions.question_text: We do not feel atmospheric pressure because:

options.text: It acts from inside our body equally

questions.explanation_correct: We do not feel atmospheric pressure because it acts equally in all directions inside our body, including from within. This means the pressure pushing on us from all sides is balanced, so we do not notice it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The atmospheric pressure is very real and significant, around 100,000 Pascals at sea level. We do not feel it because it acts evenly from all directions within our body, cancelling out. It is not small, and our weight does not affect how we experience atmospheric pressure.

questions.question_text: One Pascal is equal to:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 1 N/m^2. This is because the definition of pressure is force per unit area. The SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa), and 1 Pascal is defined as 1 Newton per square meter (1 N/m^2).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because they do not match the definition of pressure. Option A) 1 N/m is the unit of force per unit length, not pressure. Option C) 1 N x m is the unit of work or energy, and Option D) 1 N x m^2 is the unit of torque, which is not related to pressure.

questions.question_text: A sharp knife cuts better than a blunt knife because:

options.text: It has a smaller area, so greater pressure
It is made of better material

questions.explanation_correct: A sharp knife cuts better than a blunt knife because it has a smaller area, so the same force is applied over a smaller surface. This results in a higher pressure, which helps the knife cut through the material more easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sharp knife does not cut better because it applies more force or because it is heavier. The reason a sharp knife cuts better is that it has a smaller area, so the same force is applied over a smaller surface. This higher pressure is what allows the knife to cut through the material more effectively.

questions.question_text: Why do camels have broad flat feet?

options.text: To look different from other animals
To reduce pressure on sand and not sink

questions.explanation_correct: Camels have broad, flat feet to reduce the pressure on the sand and prevent them from sinking. When the same force (the camel's weight) is applied over a larger area (the broad flat feet), the pressure is reduced. This allows the camel to walk on soft desert sand without sinking.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options do not explain why camels have broad flat feet. Option A is not relevant, option B is incorrect because foot shape does not affect running speed, and option D is wrong because increasing pressure would make the camel sink deeper into the sand, which is the opposite of what the broad feet are designed to do.

questions.question_text: A force of 100 N acts on an area of 2 m^2. What is the pressure?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 50 Pa. Pressure is defined as force per unit area. The formula for pressure is P = F/A, where P is pressure, F is force, and A is the area. In this case, the force is 100 N and the area is 2 m^2. Plugging these values into the formula, we get P = 100 N / 2 m^2 = 50 Pa.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not correctly apply the formula for pressure. Option A) 200 Pa is incorrect because the pressure would be 100 N / 2 m^2 = 50 Pa. Option C) 100 Pa is incorrect because the pressure would be 100 N / 2 m^2 = 50 Pa. Option D) 102 Pa is incorrect because the pressure would be 100 N / 2 m^2 = 50 Pa, not 102 Pa.

questions.question_text: A drinking straw works because of:
questions.explanation_correct: A drinking straw works because of atmospheric pressure pushing the liquid up. The air pressure outside the straw is greater than the pressure inside the straw, which causes the liquid to be pushed up the straw and into your mouth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The drinking straw does not work due to gravity pulling the liquid, magnetic force, or heat from the mouth. Gravity would actually pull the liquid down, not up the straw. Magnetic force and heat do not play a role in how a straw functions. The correct reason is that atmospheric pressure pushes the liquid up the straw.

questions.question_text: Water tanks are placed at a height because:

options.text: Water flows better due to higher pressure

questions.explanation_correct: Water tanks are placed at a height because the higher position creates more pressure on the water. This higher pressure makes the water flow more easily and reach more areas without using extra pumps.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water tanks are not placed at a height just to make them look better or to keep them clean. They are also not placed there to protect them from animals. The correct reason is that the higher position of the tank creates more pressure on the water, which makes it flow better to different areas.

questions.question_text: Why do tractors have broad tyres?

options.text: To increase pressure on the ground
To reduce pressure on the ground

questions.explanation_correct: Tractors have broad tyres to reduce the pressure on the ground. When the same force (weight of the tractor) is applied over a larger area (broad tyres), the pressure on the ground decreases. This helps the tractor avoid getting stuck in soft or muddy terrain.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A, 'To increase pressure on the ground', is incorrect. Increasing the area of the tyre actually reduces the pressure on the ground. Broad tyres distribute the weight of the tractor over a larger area, resulting in lower pressure on the ground compared to narrow tyres.

questions.question_text: A dam has thicker walls at the bottom because:

options.text: Water pressure is higher at the bottom
The foundation needs to be wider
To save material at the top

questions.explanation_correct: The dam has thicker walls at the bottom because the water pressure is higher at the bottom of the dam. As you go deeper in water, the pressure increases. This is because there is more water pressing down on the bottom parts of the dam, and so the walls need to be thicker to withstand this higher pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is option B - water pressure is higher at the bottom. The other options are incorrect. Option A is wrong because the thickness of the dam walls has nothing to do with how the dam looks. Option C is incorrect because the foundation width is not related to the water pressure. Option D is wrong because the dam is not made thicker at the top to save material - it is thicker at the bottom to handle the higher water pressure there.

questions.question_text: Suction cups stick to smooth surfaces because of:
questions.explanation_correct: Suction cups stick to smooth surfaces due to atmospheric pressure. When the suction cup is pressed against the surface, the air inside is pushed out, creating a partial vacuum. This lower pressure inside the suction cup compared to the higher atmospheric pressure outside causes the suction cup to stick to the surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Suction cups do not stick to surfaces due to friction, gravity, or magnetic force. Friction and gravity cannot create the suction effect that holds the suction cup in place. Magnetic force is only applicable for magnetic surfaces, not the smooth surfaces that suction cups typically stick to.

questions.question_text: A person wearing high heels exerts more pressure on the floor than when wearing flat shoes because:

options.text: High heels have smaller contact area

questions.explanation_correct: The person wearing high heels exerts more pressure on the floor because high heels have a smaller contact area with the floor compared to flat shoes. The same force applied over a smaller area results in higher pressure, which is why high heels exert more pressure than flat shoes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Options A and C are incorrect because the weight and force applied by the person are not the main factors that determine the pressure. Option D is incorrect because flat shoes are not necessarily lighter than high heels. The correct explanation is that high heels have a smaller contact area with the floor, so the same force is applied over a smaller surface, resulting in higher pressure.

questions.question_text: If two holes are made at different heights in a container full of water, water will come out:

options.text: With same force from both holes
With more force from the upper hole
With more force from the lower hole

questions.explanation_correct: Water will come out with more force from the lower hole because pressure in liquids increases with depth. The pressure at the lower hole is greater than the pressure at the upper hole, so the water will come out with more force from the lower hole.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because pressure in liquids increases with depth. The pressure at the lower hole is greater than the pressure at the upper hole, so the water will come out with more force from the lower hole. It will not come out with the same force or only from the upper hole.

questions.question_text: A force of 500 N is applied on an area of 0.5 m^2. The pressure is:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 1000 Pa because pressure is defined as force per unit area. With a force of 500 N applied over an area of 0.5 m^2, the pressure will be 500 N / 0.5 m^2 = 1000 Pa.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are A) 250 Pa, B) 500 Pa, and D) 100 Pa. These answers do not correctly calculate the pressure using the given force and area. The correct formula to calculate pressure is pressure = force / area, so the pressure in this case is 1000 Pa.

questions.question_text: Buildings have wide foundations to:
questions.explanation_correct: Buildings have wide foundations to reduce the pressure on the ground. The wider the foundation, the lower the pressure exerted on the soil, which helps prevent the building from sinking or collapsing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because: A) Increasing the pressure on the ground would make the building less stable, not more stable. C) The wide foundation is not just for making the building look stable, but to actually distribute the weight and pressure. D) Using more material is not the main reason for the wide foundation, the pressure distribution is the key factor.

questions.question_text: When you suck air out of a syringe with its nozzle blocked, the piston is difficult to pull because:
questions.explanation_correct: When you suck air out of a syringe with its nozzle blocked, the piston becomes difficult to pull because the atmospheric pressure outside the syringe pushes against the piston, making it harder to move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Option A (friction is high) is wrong because friction does not increase when the nozzle is blocked. Option C (the syringe is too small) is wrong because the size of the syringe does not affect the pressure. Option D (the piston is heavy) is wrong because the weight of the piston does not change when the nozzle is blocked.

questions.question_text: Liquid pressure depends on:
questions.explanation_correct: Liquid pressure depends on the depth and density of the liquid. The deeper you go in a liquid, the greater the pressure due to the weight of the liquid above. The density of the liquid also affects the pressure - liquids with higher density will have higher pressure at the same depth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Liquid pressure does not depend on the shape of the container or the color of the liquid. It also does not depend on the temperature of the liquid. Liquid pressure is determined by the depth of the liquid and its density - the deeper the liquid and the higher its density, the greater the pressure.

questions.question_text: A nail has a pointed end so that:

options.text: Less force is needed to hammer it
High pressure is exerted for easy penetration

questions.explanation_correct: A nail has a pointed end so that it can exert high pressure for easy penetration into a surface. Pressure is defined as force per unit area. When the same force is applied over a smaller area (like the pointed end of a nail), the pressure increases, allowing the nail to easily pierce through the surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the main reasons for a nail having a pointed end. Option A is just a description of how the nail looks, not the reason for its design. Option B is incorrect because the force needed to hammer the nail in does not depend on the nail's pointed end - the pointed end increases the pressure, not the force. Option D is incorrect because the nail's pointed end does not prevent it from rusting.

questions.question_text: If you double the area on which a force acts, the pressure becomes:
questions.explanation_correct: If you double the area on which the same force is applied, the pressure will become half. This is because pressure is the force per unit area, and when the area is doubled, the force remains the same, so the pressure gets divided by 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pressure becomes half when the area is doubled because pressure is the force divided by the area. If the force remains the same but the area is doubled, the pressure will be divided by 2. Option A (double) and D (four times) are incorrect because the pressure should decrease when the area increases.

questions.question_text: Atmospheric pressure decreases as we go to higher altitudes because:

options.text: The column of air above decreases

questions.explanation_correct: As we go to higher altitudes, the column of air above us decreases. This means there is less air exerting pressure on us, so the atmospheric pressure decreases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Atmospheric pressure does not decrease because of temperature, gravity, or air density. The correct reason is that as we go higher, the column of air above us becomes shorter. This means there is less air pushing down on us, causing the atmospheric pressure to decrease.

questions.question_text: Deep-sea divers experience high pressure because:

options.text: There is more water above them
There is less water above them

questions.explanation_correct: Deep-sea divers experience high pressure because the water above them exerts a greater force per unit area (pressure) as they go deeper. The more water above them, the higher the pressure they experience.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Deep-sea divers do not experience high pressure because of colder or warmer water. The pressure they feel is due to the weight of the water column above them. As they go deeper, there is more water pressing down on them, increasing the pressure they feel.

questions.question_text: Army tanks have broad tracks (caterpillar wheels) to:

options.text: Reduce pressure on ground and prevent sinking

questions.explanation_correct: Army tanks have broad tracks (caterpillar wheels) to reduce the pressure on the ground and prevent the tank from sinking. When the same force (weight of the tank) is distributed over a larger area (the broad tracks), the pressure exerted on the ground is lower, allowing the tank to move without getting stuck.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The broad tracks on army tanks are not meant to make the tank move faster or look more powerful. They also do not increase the friction between the tank and the ground. The purpose of the broad tracks is to reduce the pressure exerted by the tank's weight on the ground, preventing the tank from sinking or getting stuck.

questions.question_text: A block exerts a pressure of 200 Pa on the ground. If the block is placed on its side with half the area, the new pressure will be:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 400 Pa. When the block is placed on its side, the area in contact with the ground is halved. Since pressure is defined as force divided by area, and the force remains the same, the pressure will double from 200 Pa to 400 Pa.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is A) 100 Pa. This is not correct because when the area is halved, the pressure increases, not decreases. Pressure is directly proportional to the force and inversely proportional to the area. So, if the force remains the same and the area is halved, the pressure will double from 200 Pa to 400 Pa.

questions.question_text: Air has:
questions.explanation_correct: Air has weight and exerts pressure. All gases, including air, have mass and therefore exert a force (weight) on the surface below. This weight of the air creates pressure on the surface, which we call atmospheric pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air does not have 'no weight' or 'weight but no pressure'. Air has weight due to its mass, and this weight creates a pressure that is exerted on all surfaces. Air pressure is an important force that affects many phenomena in our daily lives.

questions.question_text: Pressure is the force acting per unit area.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Pressure is the force acting per unit area' is true. Pressure is defined as the force acting on a surface divided by the area of that surface. The SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect statement would be 'Pressure is the force acting on a surface'. This is not entirely correct because pressure depends not only on the force, but also on the area over which the force is applied. When the same force is applied over a smaller area, the pressure increases. For example, a sharp knife can cut better than a dull knife because the same force is applied over a smaller area, resulting in higher pressure.

questions.question_text: The SI unit of pressure is Newton.
questions.explanation_correct: The SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa), not Newton. Pressure is defined as the force acting per unit area, and the SI unit for this is Pascal, not Newton.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The SI unit of force is Newton, but the SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa). Pressure is a different physical quantity from force, and it is measured in terms of the force acting per unit area, not just the force alone. So the correct SI unit for pressure is Pascal, not Newton.

questions.question_text: Pressure in a liquid decreases with depth.
questions.explanation_correct: Pressure in a liquid increases with depth, not decreases. This is because the weight of the liquid above a given point exerts more pressure on that point as the depth increases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pressure in a liquid actually increases with depth, not decreases. This is because the weight of the liquid above a given point exerts more pressure on that point as the depth increases. The deeper you go, the more liquid is pushing down on that point, so the pressure is higher.

questions.question_text: Atmospheric pressure is exerted by the air around us.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer 'A' is correct because atmospheric pressure is the pressure exerted by the air around us on all surfaces. This pressure is caused by the weight of the air pushing down on the Earth's surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Atmospheric pressure is exerted by the air around us' is true. Atmospheric pressure is the pressure exerted by the air in the Earth's atmosphere on all surfaces. This pressure is caused by the weight of the air pushing down on the Earth's surface. It is not exerted by anything else, so the statement is correct.

questions.question_text: If the same force is applied on a larger area, the pressure increases.
questions.explanation_correct: If the same force is applied on a larger area, the pressure decreases. This is because pressure is defined as force per unit area. When the force is spread over a larger area, the pressure becomes lower.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false. When the same force is applied on a larger area, the pressure actually decreases. This is because pressure is calculated by dividing the force by the area. If the area is larger, the pressure will be lower even though the force remains the same.

questions.question_text: Liquids exert pressure only on the bottom of the container.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is false. Liquids exert pressure equally in all directions at a point, not just on the bottom of the container. This is because the molecules in a liquid are free to move and transmit the pressure applied on the surface to all the sides of the container.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is incorrect. Liquids do not only exert pressure on the bottom of the container. Liquids exert pressure equally in all directions at a point, not just downwards. This is because the molecules in a liquid can move freely and transmit the pressure applied on the surface to all the sides of the container, not just the bottom.

questions.question_text: A sharp knife cuts better because it exerts more pressure.
questions.explanation_correct: A sharp knife cuts better because it exerts more pressure on the same force. When the same force is applied over a smaller area (like the sharp edge of a knife), the pressure increases. This high pressure helps the knife easily cut through materials.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sharp knife does not actually exert more force. Instead, it exerts the same force over a smaller area, which increases the pressure. This high pressure is what allows the sharp knife to cut better, not the amount of force applied.

questions.question_text: A drinking straw works because of the suction created by the mouth.
questions.explanation_correct: A drinking straw works because of atmospheric pressure, not suction. When you sip through a straw, the air inside the straw is drawn up, lowering the air pressure inside. The higher atmospheric pressure outside then pushes the liquid up the straw into your mouth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement that a drinking straw works because of the suction created by the mouth is incorrect. Suction means creating a partial vacuum, but that is not how a straw works. Instead, a drinking straw works because of the difference in air pressure - the higher atmospheric pressure outside the straw pushes the liquid up into your mouth when the air pressure inside the straw is lowered.

questions.question_text: At the same depth, pressure in a liquid is the same in all directions.
questions.explanation_correct: At the same depth in a liquid, the pressure is the same in all directions. This is because the liquid molecules exert force equally in all directions, creating the same pressure all around.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. Pressure in a liquid acts equally in all directions at a point, even at the same depth. This is because the liquid molecules exert force uniformly in all directions. If the pressure was not the same, the liquid would not be able to flow freely in all directions.

questions.question_text: Camels have broad feet to increase pressure on sand.
questions.explanation_correct: Camels have broad feet to decrease pressure on the sand. This is because the same force (weight of the camel) is applied over a larger area, resulting in lower pressure. This helps the camel to easily move on the soft, sandy surface without sinking in.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Camels have broad feet to increase pressure on sand' is incorrect. Pressure is defined as force per unit area. When the same force is applied over a smaller area, the pressure increases. However, camels have broad feet to decrease the pressure on the sand, allowing them to easily walk on the soft, sandy surface without sinking in.

questions.question_text: Pressure = Force / ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Pressure is defined as the force applied per unit area. So the correct answer is that pressure is equal to force divided by area, or Pressure = Force / Area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The missing word in the equation 'Pressure = Force / ___' is 'Area'. Pressure is the amount of force applied to a surface, and it depends on both the force and the area over which the force is applied. If you apply the same force over a smaller area, the pressure will be higher. So the correct answer is that pressure equals force divided by the area it is applied to.

questions.question_text: The SI unit of pressure is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is Pascal, which is the SI (International System of Units) unit for pressure. This is because pressure is a measure of force per unit area, and the SI unit for force is Newton (N) and the SI unit for area is square meter (m). Therefore, the SI unit for pressure is Newton per square meter, which is also known as Pascal (Pa).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Pascal, which is the standard unit for measuring pressure. This is because pressure is the force applied over a given area, and the formula for pressure is force divided by area. The SI unit for force is Newton (N), and the SI unit for area is square meter (m). Therefore, the SI unit for pressure is Newton per square meter, which is also called Pascal (Pa).

questions.question_text: Force acting perpendicular to a surface is called ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The force acting perpendicular to a surface is called 'thrust'. This is because the force is pushing directly into the surface, creating pressure on it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'thrust'. The force acting perpendicular to a surface is not called 'pressure'. Pressure is the force per unit area, while thrust is the force acting directly on the surface. The accepted answer format for this fill-in-the-blank question is 'thrust'.

questions.question_text: Pressure in a liquid increases with ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Pressure in a liquid increases with depth because the weight of the liquid above exerts a greater force on the lower layers, resulting in higher pressure. The deeper you go in a liquid, the more liquid is pressing down on that point, so the pressure increases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pressure in a liquid does not increase with area, but with depth. The accepted answer format is 'depth'. As you go deeper in a liquid, the weight of the liquid above presses down more, causing the pressure to increase. Pressure is not related to the area the force is applied over - it is the force divided by the area.

questions.question_text: The pressure exerted by air is called ___ pressure.
questions.explanation_correct: The pressure exerted by the air around us is called atmospheric pressure. Air is a gas and it exerts a force on all surfaces, which is known as atmospheric pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pressure exerted by air is not called 'air' pressure, but atmospheric pressure. Atmospheric pressure is the pressure exerted by the air in the atmosphere on all objects and surfaces around us. The accepted answer format for this question is 'atmospheric'.

questions.question_text: When area decreases and force remains same, pressure ___.
questions.explanation_correct: When the area decreases and the force remains the same, the pressure increases. This is because pressure is defined as the force divided by the area. If the force stays the same but the area gets smaller, the pressure has to go up to keep the equation balanced.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'increases'. If the area decreases and the force remains the same, the pressure will go up. This is because pressure is calculated as force divided by area. So if the area gets smaller but the force stays the same, the pressure has to become larger to keep the equation balanced. The pressure does not decrease or stay the same in this case.

questions.question_text: Liquids exert pressure in ___ directions at a point.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'all' directions because liquids exert pressure equally in all directions at a point. This is due to the fact that the particles in liquids can move freely and transmit the force applied on them in all directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be a specific direction, like 'up' or 'down'. However, this is not correct because liquids exert pressure equally in all directions at a point. The pressure in a liquid acts perpendicular to the surface and is transmitted to all parts of the liquid and the container.

questions.question_text: A knife with a sharp edge exerts more ___ than a blunt knife.
questions.explanation_correct: A knife with a sharp edge exerts more pressure than a blunt knife because the same force is applied over a smaller area. This increases the pressure, which is defined as force per unit area. The sharp edge of the knife concentrates the force, resulting in higher pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'pressure'. A knife with a sharp edge exerts more pressure than a blunt knife. This is because pressure is defined as force per unit area. When the same force is applied over a smaller area, the pressure increases. The sharp edge of the knife concentrates the force, resulting in higher pressure.

questions.question_text: ___ cups work because of atmospheric pressure.
questions.explanation_correct: Suction cups work because of atmospheric pressure. The suction cup creates a partial vacuum between its surface and the object it's stuck to. The higher atmospheric pressure outside the cup then pushes the cup against the object, making it stick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The question asks about what kind of cups work due to atmospheric pressure, and the correct answer is 'Suction cups'. Suction cups stick to surfaces because of the difference in atmospheric pressure - the air pressure inside the cup is lower than the air pressure outside, which pushes the cup against the surface. Other types of cups, like regular drinking cups, do not work this way.

questions.question_text: 1 Pascal = 1 N/___.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is m^2 because pressure is defined as force per unit area. So 1 Pascal (Pa) is equal to 1 Newton of force applied over 1 square meter of area (N/m^2).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be to leave the blank as just 'm'. This is not correct because pressure is not just measured in Newtons (N), but in Newtons per square meter (N/m^2). The full unit for pressure is Pascals (Pa), which is the same as N/m^2.

questions.question_text: Tractors have ___ tyres to reduce pressure on soft ground.
questions.explanation_correct: Tractors have broad tyres to reduce the pressure on soft ground. When a larger area is in contact with the ground, the same force is distributed over a bigger surface, resulting in lower pressure. This prevents the tractor from sinking into the soft soil.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tractors would not have narrow tyres to reduce pressure on soft ground. Narrow tyres would concentrate the force on a smaller area, increasing the pressure and causing the tractor to sink deeper into the soft soil. The correct answer is 'broad' tyres, which distribute the force over a larger area and reduce the pressure on the ground.

questions.question_text: Dams have thicker walls at the ___ because water pressure is higher there.
questions.explanation_correct: Dams have thicker walls at the bottom because the pressure of the water is higher at greater depths. This is because water pressure increases with depth, as explained by the concept of pressure in liquids. The deeper the water, the higher the pressure it exerts on the dam walls.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The walls of a dam are not thicker at the top, but rather at the bottom. This is because the pressure of the water is higher at greater depths, as water pressure increases with depth. The accepted answer format for this fill-in-the-blank question is 'bottom'.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following depths in order of increasing water pressure:
questions.explanation_correct: The water pressure increases with depth. The surface has the lowest pressure, followed by 1 metre depth, then 5 metre depth, and finally 10 metre depth which has the highest pressure. This is because the deeper you go in water, the more water is above that point, which exerts a greater downward force and increases the pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to arrange the depths in reverse order - 10 metre depth, 5 metre depth, 1 metre depth, and surface. This is wrong because the pressure increases with depth, not decreases. The deeper you go in water, the more water is above that point, which means the pressure is higher at greater depths compared to shallower depths or the surface.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following objects in order of increasing pressure they exert on the ground (assuming same weight):
questions.explanation_correct: The wide flat base has the largest surface area, so the same force is distributed over a larger area, resulting in lower pressure on the ground. The pointed tip has the smallest surface area, so the same force is concentrated on a smaller area, resulting in higher pressure on the ground. The normal base is in between the wide flat base and pointed tip in terms of surface area and pressure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pointed tip does not actually exert the highest pressure on the ground. Even though it has the smallest surface area, the force applied is also likely to be smaller for a pointed object compared to a wider base. The wide flat base has the largest surface area, so it exerts the lowest pressure on the ground, while the normal base is in the middle.

questions.question_text: Arrange the steps to calculate pressure:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is to first measure the force applied, then measure the area of contact, divide the force by the area to calculate the pressure, and finally write the unit in Pascals (Pa). This follows the definition of pressure as force per unit area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to first write the unit of Pascal, then divide the force by the area. This does not make sense, as you need to measure the force and area first before you can calculate the pressure and write the unit. The correct order is to first measure the inputs (force and area), then perform the calculation, and finally write the unit.

questions.question_text: Arrange the steps of how a drinking straw works:
ordering_items: You suck air from the straw
correct_answer: You suck air from the straw
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: You suck air from the straw, Air pressure inside straw decreases, Atmospheric pressure pushes liquid up, Liquid rises up the straw. This is because when you suck air from the straw, it lowers the air pressure inside the straw. The higher atmospheric pressure outside then pushes the liquid up the straw, making it rise.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Liquid rises up the straw, Air pressure inside straw decreases, Atmospheric pressure pushes liquid up, You suck air from the straw. This is wrong because the process starts with you sucking air from the straw, which lowers the air pressure inside. The higher atmospheric pressure outside then pushes the liquid up the straw, making it rise.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following from least pressure exerted to most pressure exerted (same force):
questions.explanation_correct: The elephant foot has the largest area, so the same force applied on it would result in the least pressure. The stiletto heel has the smallest area, so the same force applied on it would result in the highest pressure. The flat shoe and sports shoe have intermediate areas, so the pressure would be in between the elephant foot and stiletto heel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Stiletto heel, Sports shoe, Flat shoe, Elephant foot. This is wrong because the stiletto heel has the smallest area, so it would exert the highest pressure. The elephant foot has the largest area, so it would exert the least pressure. The flat shoe and sports shoe have intermediate areas, so their pressures would fall in between the stiletto heel and elephant foot.
